We gathered a great deal of information from our panel of intelligence experts, which will guide our work to ensure this type of meddling never happens again. I'm honored to serve on this committee and stand with its Chairman, @RepAdamSchiff, through this vital investigation.
This morning my @HouseIntel colleagues and I held a hearing to learn more about how Russian oligarchs used their power, money and underhanded tactics to influence the 2016 elections.

I don't post throwbacks too often, but #MuslimWomensDay is a great occasion to do so! Thanks to all of my sisters throughout the years who held me down and lifted me up, and the global community of Muslim women whose contributions are making our world a better place. pic.twitter.com/PbpdShBBlH

Busy day for me and my fellow @TransportDems! I proudly voted on bills today in our committee that will ensure the FAA receives stable funding and @USCG personnel are paid in any future government shutdowns.
Also -- happy 40th birthday, @CSPAN!

Today I spoke on the House floor to urge my colleagues to support the #PaycheckFairnessAct when it comes up for a vote this week. The persistent #PayGap is harming families and sends the message that women are worth less than men. We must help change that by passing this bill. pic.twitter.com/4v6MwaSN7I

I again strongly condemn this act of discrimination by @roncallihigh and urge the administration to rethink these personnel decisions. We must all work to support our #LGBTQ brothers and sisters, not minimize them. https://twitter.com/FOX59/status/1110430013948641280 …

Attention high school students in the 7th district: The #CongressionalArtCompetition is happening now! If you win, you'll receive free travel to DC where your art will be hung in the halls of the U.S. Capitol, so don't miss out! Deadline is April 26. More:  https://bit.ly/2Ic8Fd0  pic.twitter.com/wohDb2sSOj

Glad to join @TransportDems in our important hearing today on improving airport infrastructure and the need to update the Passenger Facility Charge. This is a priority for public safety as well as our economy. #PFC #RaiseTheCap

The #Trump administration has now moved from sabotage of the #ACA to full-scale obliteration. We must continue fighting as hard as we can to save this landmark law and the protections it has provided for millions of Americans. #ProtectOurCare https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1110489972359000064 …

We should #CelebrateGovWorkers year-round, but especially during Federal Employee Appreciation Week, happening now. Here in Indy, and across the country, their tireless work keeps our communities afloat and ensures Americans' needs are met. To all of these folks -- thank you!

I hope everybody celebrating had an excellent #Nowruz yesterday. Like the first day of #Spring, this commemoration of the new year represents renewal and a chance for new beginnings, so let's all make the most of this fresh start!

50 in New Zealand are killed, and Prime Minister @JacindaArdern rightfully takes action. 

How many thousands of Americans must also be murdered by these #assaultweapons for our country to do the same? https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1108669595055988736 …

Restoring #NetNeutrality is one of the most important goals of the 116th Congress. That's why I'm cosponsoring the #SaveTheNet Act, to bring back these vital protections that help ensure a free and open internet. We won't let #Trump’s @FCC take that away from us! pic.twitter.com/ejRJaX8B5g

President Trump's FY2020 #budget request further highlights his misplaced priorities. He can't seem to find the money for vital programs that help #Hoosier families thrive, yet allocates billions for an ineffective wall? What we really can't afford is this cruel plan. pic.twitter.com/98cxFQQF2x

I had a great tour today of the Amazon Fulfillment Center in Whitestown, where I spoke with employees about the company's growing presence in Indiana and how it utilizes robotics and logistics. It's fascinating to see the operation in place that gets packages to our front door. pic.twitter.com/x0DqKQWsRD

Spoke to @Cheddar today about the continued grounding of Boeing 737 Max 8's after the tragic Ethiopian Airlines crash. It's clear that Congress, regulators and manufacturers must do more to prevent future tragedies. pic.twitter.com/djVHbzR6L6

Great article about a welcome trend. Not only should Congress look more like our nation as a whole, but so should the folks who help my colleagues and I serve our constituents. Let’s keep it up! https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/15/us/house-staff-minorities-democrats.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share …

After today's horrific terror attack in #NewZealand, where do we go from here? First and foremost, we must come together as a global, interfaith community to condemn this violence. And we must also take steps to end the toxic climate of hatred and bigotry. @TheLeadCNN pic.twitter.com/VCOwMSpjSf

Kudos to the @AmericanLegion on its centennial. On this #AmericanLegionDay, we honor the brave service members who continued to support their country, their community, and their fellow veterans as active members of the Legion. Indy is so proud to call you friends and neighbors.

We must unite as a global community, of many different nationalities, faiths and cultures, to stand against this violence and intolerance, and ensure those who perpetuate these cancers on our world are brought to justice.

These people who were massacred, and all people, should be able to worship peacefully and openly without fear. It breaks my heart that this basic human right continues to be violated so often and so horrifically, with tragic consequences.

Today I’m grieving for the victims of this horrific terrorist attack in #Christchurch, New Zealand, praying for their loved ones grappling with this shocking loss of life, and reaffirming my commitment to eradicate hatred and #Islamophobia.

#RIP Sen. #BirchBayh, the last living Senator to have voted for the Civil Rights Act of 1964. We thank him, not only for this, but for his efforts to promote #genderequality, increase access to the ballot box, and more. We honor this political giant who fought for the little guy. pic.twitter.com/HGXtTa5HUi

Thanks to my Senate colleagues for joining the House in voting to reject President #Trump's #FakeEmergency Declaration to build his wall. R's and D's alike know the truth: Trump is ignoring the Constitution and abusing his power to keep alive his pointless vanity project.

In a majority of states, including Indiana, it's perfectly legal to deny basic rights and services to people because of their gender identity or sexual orientation. That's why it's vital for Congress to step up and work to end this discrimination by passing this landmark bill.

The fight for civil rights is an ongoing journey, and today, @HouseDemocrats made headway by introducing the #EqualityAct, which establishes long-overdue federal protections for our #LGBTQ brothers and sisters. pic.twitter.com/TWk9LahWG0

#PaulManafort's additional sentencing today further shows the serious crimes and other wrongdoings that are being uncovered by Special Counsel #Mueller and his team. We must continue to support this vital investigation's continued efforts on behalf of our Democracy.

At a @TransportDems hearing on #21stCenturyInvesments to surface transportation, I proudly introduced Mike Terry, President and CEO of @IndyGoBus, who is testifying before the committee. His leadership has greatly improved our transit, and we welcome his expertise in Washington. pic.twitter.com/0MbdWfevQ9

So pleased by the turnout at this year’s Youth Opportunities Fair and thankful for the local partners lending their support. That first summer job, camp, or service experience can be life-changing for a young person, and today we helped make them happen! #CarsonYOF pic.twitter.com/mcWighZQmd

My Youth Opportunities Fair is starting now and lasts until 7pm! Head over to   Central Library to discover the many great opportunities for young people in our community. @indylibrary pic.twitter.com/MFt3KWvTiH

Great to see more women running, winning and making a difference not only in Congress, but across Indiana. Happy #InternationalWomensDay to this group of legislators, the special women and girls in our lives, and all of the women who inspire us, today and every day. https://twitter.com/inhsedems/status/1104028878438305793 …

So pleased the House passed #HR1 today. This is a big win for democracy! For too long, shady special interests have called the shots, using their pocketbooks to drown out the voice of the people. Today's vote represents a big step to end this culture of corruption. #ForThePeople

We must continue these tough but productive discussions about difficult topics— including Palestine and Israel. They won't be easy, but we must have them in order to steer our nation in the right direction.
We sent a clear message today that @HouseDemocrats are united in our shared opposition to hatred, bigotry and discrimination, but we can't stop here.

After more than a decade in Congress, this was my first opportunity to vote on a resolution that condemned anti-Muslim hate. As a Muslim-American, this is an important step in the right direction — to condemn hate in all its forms.
A reminder that this great event is happening soon! I hope to see you there. https://twitter.com/RepAndreCarson/status/1101262055708024832 …
Excellent! #VoterSuppression is real, and Congress must tackle it. https://twitter.com/OversightDems/status/1103364485333569537 …

It is unacceptable that President Trump cancelled the annual report on civilian casualties from drone strikes. Drones can be an important counter-terrorism tool, but holding ourselves to a high standard means understanding their impact on innocent people. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1103389547658911744 …

Religious intolerance against all faiths must be condemned. Let's work to ensure our diverse beliefs are a catalyst for productive dialogue that acknowledges our shared humanity. Faith should not be a means to divide us.

We must always strive to be inclusive and tolerant -- understanding that our words hold tremendous power, and sometimes cause pain. But in doing so, we cannot shut down legitimate policy debate. @Ilhan has raised valid points about Palestine and Israel that should be debated.

I certainly respect spirited debate, but @HouseGOP's arguments opposing #HR1 on the House floor today are weak. If you're arguing AGAINST expanding voting rights and FOR dark-money special interests, you're not #ForThePeople. I'll proudly vote for it, and I hope they do as well.

#OTD in 2017, President #Trump issued his revised #TravelBan. The effects of this vile directive are still being felt -- families remain torn apart and our image around the world continues to suffer. We must keep working to end this testament to xenophobia and Islamophobia. pic.twitter.com/83ScKmsaPY

During #WomensHistoryMonth, we honor all the women -- notable and unsung -- who have shaped America for the better. I'm privileged to work alongside a record number of women in Congress, and live among many more changing our world in countless ways. Your efforts mean so much. pic.twitter.com/rGEKAYd5AS
